edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers

Interface Colorable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ball, ConsumingBall, EvadingBall, ExpandableBall, IntelligentBall

    public interface Colorable
    The colorable interface guarantees that an object will have color related attributes that can be accessed using the following getter/setter methods.
    Author:
    Andrew Case

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBlue() 
      int getGreen() 
      int getRed() 
      void setColor(int grayscale) 
      void setColor(int r, int g, int b) 

    • Method Detail

      • getRed

        int getRed()
        Returns:
        the red color component for this object (a value between 0 - 255)

      • getGreen

        int getGreen()
        Returns:
        the green color component for this object (a value between 0 - 255)

      • getBlue

        int getBlue()
        Returns:
        the blue color component for this object (a value between 0 - 255)

      • setColor

        void setColor(int grayscale)
        Parameters:
        grayscale - is the value to set all three color components to (valid values are between 0-255). For example, if a user passes in the value 128, it will set the red, green, and blue components all to 128.

      • setColor

        void setColor(int r,
            int g,
            int b)
        Parameters:
        r - is the red component for this objects color. Valid values are from 0-255.
        g - is the green component for this objects color. Valid values are from 0-255.
        b - is the blue component for this objects color. Valid values are from 0-255.
